distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat Satellite 6.15 for RHEL 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which
gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from
the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Satellite is a system management solution that allows organizations
to configure and maintain their systems without the necessity to provide
public Internet access to their servers or other client systems. It
performs provisioning and configuration management of predefined standard
operating environments.

Security Fix(es):

* rubygem-activestorage: Possible Sensitive Session Information Leak in Active Storage (CVE-2024-26144)
* rubygem-rack: Possible Denial of Service Vulnerability in Rack Header Parsing (CVE-2024-26146)
* rubygem-rack: Possible DoS Vulnerability with Range Header in Rack (CVE-2024-26141)
* rubygem-rack: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Rack Content-Type Parsing (CVE-2024-25126)
* python-ecdsa: vulnerable to the Minerva attack (CVE-2024-23342)

Users of Red Hat Satellite are advised to upgrade to these updated
packages, which fix these bugs.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in the `ecdsa` PyPI package, a pure Python implementation of ECC (Elliptic Curve Cryptography) with support for ECDSA (Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm), EdDSA (Edwards-curve Digital Signature Algorithm) and ECDH (Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman). Versions 0.18.0 and prior may be vulnerable to the Minerva attack.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: python-ecdsa: vulnerable to the Minerva attack
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For detailed instructions how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_satellite/6.15/html/updating_red_hat_satellite/index

vulnerabilities.title: python-ecdsa: vulnerable to the Minerva attack

notes.text: A denial of service (DoS) vulnerability was found in rubygem-rack in how it parses Content-Type. Carefully crafted content type headers can cause Rackâs media type parser to take much longer than expected, leading to a possible denial of service vulnerability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygem-rack: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Rack Content-Type Parsing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For detailed instructions how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_satellite/6.15/html/updating_red_hat_satellite/index
No mitigation is currently available for this vulnerability. The recommendation is to perform updates as soon as they are available.

vulnerabilities.title: rubygem-rack: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Rack Content-Type Parsing

notes.text: A denial of service (DoS) vulnerability was found in rubygem-rack in how it parses Range Header. Carefully crafted range headers can cause a server to respond with an unexpectedly large response. Responding with large responses could lead to a denial of service issue.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygem-rack: Possible DoS Vulnerability with Range Header in Rack
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat rates this vulnerability as a Moderate impact as this requires a specifically crafted response.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

No mitigation is currently available for this vulnerability. The recommendation is to perform updates as soon as they are available.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in Active Storage that may lead to a sensitive session information leak. By default, Active Storage sends a `Set-Cookie` header along with the userâs session cookie when serving blobs and sets `Cache-Control` to public. Certain proxies may cache `Set-Cookie`, leading to an information leak.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygem-activestorage: Possible Sensitive Session Information Leak in Active Storage
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: rubygem-activestorage: Possible Sensitive Session Information Leak in Active Storage

notes.text: A denial of service (DoS) vulnerability was found in rubygem-rack in how it parses Rack Header. Carefully crafted headers can cause header parsing in Rack to take longer than expected, resulting in a possible denial of service issue. Accept and Forwarded headers are impacted.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygem-rack: Possible Denial of Service Vulnerability in Rack Header Parsing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

No mitigation is currently available for this vulnerability. The recommendation is to perform updates as soon as they are available.
